3023696c-76ae-43cd-bf57-c4e9b8a68bea.description: Earners have served as a volunteer Mentor in the UNM Anderson School of Management Mentorship Program. Mentors coach and help undergraduate students develop career management skills to prepare for entrance into the professional job market. Emphasis on cover letters, resumes, interviewing skills, networking, job search and career development and planning.
3023696c-76ae-43cd-bf57-c4e9b8a68bea.name: UNM Anderson Mentor

issuer.summary: issued by University of New Mexico - Anderson School of Management Executive & Professional Education

entity.name: University of New Mexico - Anderson School of Management Executive & Professional Education

badge_template_activities.title: Served as a volunteer mentor in the UNM Anderson School of Management Mentorship Program for one or more semesters. Ongoing voluntary commitment to the UNM Anderson Mentorship Program. To sign-up to become a Mentor and for more information please visit: mgt.unm.edu/engage/mentor.asp

1dde8958-ed0e-4e03-b594-687989b26d36.description: Project managers need to manage every aspect of the projects they oversee, from resources and suppliers to project costs and equipment. Effective project management is essential in today’s business world, and project management training will give you a competitive edge in the job market, providing skills that you can apply immediately to your work. 4 CEUs.
1dde8958-ed0e-4e03-b594-687989b26d36.name: Practical Project Management

issuer.summary: issued by University of New Mexico - Anderson School of Management Executive & Professional Education

entity.name: University of New Mexico - Anderson School of Management Executive & Professional Education

badge_template_activities.title: The interactive curriculum of Practical Project Management provides you with the essential tools needed to keep projects on task, on time, and within budget. The program is taught by highly qualified instructors who have substantial project management experience.

60f4119e-0126-4008-9998-8733ca4f0bd4.description: Essentials for Managers Certificate Program will helps those new to management or aspiring to become a leader assess and develop leadership style and responsibilities to build credibility and support. In ten weeks, students develop the essential leadership skills that will improve performance through empowerment and effective delegation. 3 CEUs.
60f4119e-0126-4008-9998-8733ca4f0bd4.name: Essentials for Managers

issuer.summary: issued by University of New Mexico - Anderson School of Management Executive & Professional Education

entity.name: University of New Mexico - Anderson School of Management Executive & Professional Education

badge_template_activities.title: Taught by experts in their field, this practical course examines the functions of planning, organizing and leading, and translates these essential management activities into the skills necessary to perform successfully in today’s competitive workplace.

138c18b4-2728-40cb-a8af-be538985d09f.description: Mastering mediation skills that can lead to new career opportunities or advancement. In addition to resolving conflicts, mediations and mediator skills increase productivity, save time and money, greatly contribute to creating a safer workplace, and promote a climate of collaboration. 4 CEUs.
138c18b4-2728-40cb-a8af-be538985d09f.name: Mediation 40-Hour Basic Course

issuer.summary: issued by University of New Mexico - Anderson School of Management Executive & Professional Education

entity.name: University of New Mexico - Anderson School of Management Executive & Professional Education

badge_template_activities.title: During the Mediation 40-Hour Basic course, students engage in small group, coached role-play sessions to enhance understanding and to experience the dynamics of mediation and get the skills needed to help bring disputes to resolution. Students who successfully complete this 40-Hour course the digital credential which may be necessary to mediate in some programs and settings. Students also have an opportunity to earn a Mediation Practitioners Badge after completion of the course.

f2dd8b8f-7694-4d06-9c08-b7f09831cc75.description: Cultivate leadership potential and build professional experience in the Women’s Leadership Development Program. Join Anderson School of Management's top faculty and instructors to develop and fine-tune the skills necessary to become an effective and visionary leader. 1.6 CEUs.
f2dd8b8f-7694-4d06-9c08-b7f09831cc75.name: Women's Leadership Development

issuer.summary: issued by University of New Mexico - Anderson School of Management Executive & Professional Education

entity.name: University of New Mexico - Anderson School of Management Executive & Professional Education

badge_template_activities.title: Explore the barriers women face, build upon unique strengths, and acquire new strategic and tactical tools for continuous growth as a leader. In addition, meet and engage with a group of like-minded strong and supportive women to build a lifelong network.

51db94b5-5452-4ffd-84ad-b6378ee0c4e7.description: Now, more than ever, organizations are turning to their human resource professionals to help guide them through these challenging times. Be the one they turn too! Aim to increase your professional value and enhance your career by earning your SHRM certification. We have enhanced our already robust program to include live, interactive online sessions. Plus, an option to pay for the SHRM Exam Prep program along with a SHRM Exam seat in one easy step.
51db94b5-5452-4ffd-84ad-b6378ee0c4e7.name: SHRM Exam Prep

issuer.summary: issued by University of New Mexico - Anderson School of Management Executive & Professional Education

entity.name: University of New Mexico - Anderson School of Management Executive & Professional Education

badge_template_activities.title: Twelve Sessions (Must attend 10 out of 12) 1. Intro & Pre-Test | HR Competencies, 2. Business & HR Strategy, 3. Talent Acquisition & Retention, 4. Employee Engagement, 5. Learning & Development, 6. Total Rewards | HR Structure, 7. Organizational Effectiveness & Development | Workforce Management, 8. Employee Relations, Technology, and Data 9. Global HR | Diversity & Inclusion, 10. Risk Management | Corporate Social Responsibility, 11. U.S. Employment Law & Regulation, 12. Final Exam & Discussion

d08190ec-5da7-4c86-ad73-531f4ac4a8d5.description: Nonprofit Leadership covers critical aspects of nonprofit management which will aid professional growth and help make any nonprofit a success. This program provides the skills necessary for strategic planning, financial management, human resource management, leadership development, marketing, fundraising, and more. 1.6 CEUs.
d08190ec-5da7-4c86-ad73-531f4ac4a8d5.name: Nonprofit Leadership Development

issuer.summary: issued by University of New Mexico - Anderson School of Management Executive & Professional Education

entity.name: University of New Mexico - Anderson School of Management Executive & Professional Education

badge_template_activities.title: Organizational Leadership: Preparation for Leadership Voluntary Leadership: Board Governance & Best Practices Evaluating Legal and Ethical Issues Facing Nonprofit Corporations Strategic and Operational Planning for Nonprofits Human Resources for Leaders of Nonprofits Advertising, Promotions, and Marketing Communications Building Capacity Through Social Enterprise

69d50a54-d63f-409d-8699-9c20d006cce8.description: Students completed a five-day English intensive workshop designed specifically for business students at Yamanashi Gakuin University in Japan. This workshop includes business idea pitch coaching, as well as lectures focusing on entrepreneurial finance and international business culture. Students spent the week preparing five minute business pitch presentations in English. The workshop culminated in a pitch competition for a panel of judges made up of industry experts and business professors.
69d50a54-d63f-409d-8699-9c20d006cce8.name: UNM Anderson Entrepreneurship Workshop

issuer.summary: issued by University of New Mexico - Anderson School of Management Executive & Professional Education

entity.name: University of New Mexico - Anderson School of Management Executive & Professional Education

badge_template_activities.title: Must have completed the Kono Seminar - UNM Anderson School of Management's Innovation Academy Entrepreneurship Workshop.

2d13cf68-e307-4f79-acf5-b2d09316db42.description: The University of New Mexico is a National Science foundation (NSF) I-Corps Site. The I-Corps Site’s purpose is to foster innovation among faculty and students, promote regional coordination and linkages in the innovation ecosystem, as well as develop a National Innovation Network. Request for proposals are issued twice each year (in the Fall and Spring) The program offers seed funding to each selected team to be used to explore to commercialization and prototyping.
2d13cf68-e307-4f79-acf5-b2d09316db42.name: Lobo Rainforest I-Corps Program Completion

issuer.summary: issued by University of New Mexico - Anderson School of Management Executive & Professional Education

entity.name: University of New Mexico - Anderson School of Management Executive & Professional Education

badge_template_activities.title: Is your technology ready for the market? Explore the transition of your technology to the marketplace through 10 weeks of entrepreneurial training from the Lobo Rainforest I-Corps program. Determine the value proposition, customer, the size of the market, and market trends for your technology. Receive a dedicated mentor to provide one-on-one guidance through the program Learn to use tools such as Slack and Zoom Receive $3,000 for customer discovery efforts and proof-of-concept prototyping.

97c7e72f-0510-4eb5-83c4-0fed047601ac.description: To facilitate with finesse in today’s world, meeting facilitators must be proficient in designing and facilitating meetings regardless of whether those meetings are in-person, online or hybrid. This nine week, 36-hour live online training includes vital tools, techniques, and understandings for designing meetings and facilitating groups (large & small) in-person, online and in a hybrid format. There are demonstrations and coached practice sessions interspersed throughout the training.
97c7e72f-0510-4eb5-83c4-0fed047601ac.name: Facilitating with Finesse

issuer.summary: issued by University of New Mexico - Anderson School of Management Executive & Professional Education

entity.name: University of New Mexico - Anderson School of Management Executive & Professional Education

badge_template_activities.title: Students learned to design meetings that efficiently accomplish the meeting objectives, engage meeting participants with a wide variety of techniques, create an arena of productive collaboration, skillfully manage groups of three to 300, and harvest the meeting work product into highly usable content to perpetuate productivity after the meeting.

6ca4d671-c194-49ae-9352-8481b3014f62.description: The program begins with Workplace Communication and progresses into Conflict Resolution that focus on specific skills, such as Defining and Reframing Conflict and Steps to Conflict Resolution. Topics include: Active Listening and Defining and Reframing Conflict.
6ca4d671-c194-49ae-9352-8481b3014f62.name: Workplace Communication & Conflict Resolution

issuer.summary: issued by University of New Mexico - Anderson School of Management Executive & Professional Education

entity.name: University of New Mexico - Anderson School of Management Executive & Professional Education

badge_template_activities.title: Custom Training Course for VA Albuquerque Regional Office

b35952a4-505f-4950-94b8-cbcbbddb7208.description: The badge recipient has successfully completed a 3-credit course through the UNM Anderson Facilitated Internship Program. The internship offers qualified students a unique integration of the academic program, practical application, and skill development in a “real world” employment opportunity, focused on their major and/or field of study.
b35952a4-505f-4950-94b8-cbcbbddb7208.name: UNM Anderson Internship Completion Badge

issuer.summary: issued by University of New Mexico - Anderson School of Management Executive & Professional Education

entity.name: University of New Mexico - Anderson School of Management Executive & Professional Education

badge_template_activities.title: The badge recipient has successfully earned 3-credits through the UNM Anderson Internship Program by completing a minimum of 160 hours in an approved facilitated internship position. The recipient has completed the Internship course with a grade of B+ or higher.

3c0fecde-5d34-4164-a5a8-c429ce7bbbcb.description: Validating an Outdoor Recreation Business Idea will deliver a process and offer tools for entrepreneurs to iterate, test, and validate their outdoor recreation idea and business model, determining problem-solution fit and business model support.
3c0fecde-5d34-4164-a5a8-c429ce7bbbcb.name: Validating an Outdoor Recreation Business Idea Certificate

issuer.summary: issued by University of New Mexico - Anderson School of Management Executive & Professional Education

entity.name: University of New Mexico - Anderson School of Management Executive & Professional Education

alignments.name: Participant Requirements
alignments.description: 1. Attend every Saturday workshop and mentoring session (180 minutes per week) 2. Attend at least two of the four Tuesday lunchtime presentations (60 minutes each) 3. Complete weekly readings and assignments (estimated hours per week included in the syllabus) 4. Provide weekly updates to the certificate team, including your mentor

badge_template_activities.title: Specific certificate outcomes include: 1. Telling your startup idea and beginning to map your idea using the Lean Canvas as a guide. 2. Refining the identified solution using the Job to Be Done concepts and introduce diagnosing the entrepreneur’s Lean Canvas. 3. Visualizing the entrepreneur’s business model and determining traction of the business model. 4. Incorporating social and environmental impact principles into the startup; e.g., why doing good matters for outdoor recreation startups.

c9d2f138-74f9-4d3f-a98b-547126ca1a9c.description: Awarded for completion of the Community Leadership Series Custom Training created for Guadalupe County Developmental Corporation by the UNM Anderson Corporate and Community Engagement Office - Executive and Professional Education program.
c9d2f138-74f9-4d3f-a98b-547126ca1a9c.name: Community Leadership Series - Guadalupe County Developmental Corporation

issuer.summary: issued by University of New Mexico - Anderson School of Management Executive & Professional Education

entity.name: University of New Mexico - Anderson School of Management Executive & Professional Education

badge_template_activities.title: The goal of this training is to provide leadership development training to Guadalupe County community industries. The instruction includes effective tools that can be applied immediately and maintained throughout the participant’s professional career. Exercises and role-playing activities ensure participants stay engaged and have the opportunity to apply the tools to current performance issues and align the employees’ personal values to the organization.

9c0f22de-bbf8-47c2-9857-60fd81c29eab.description: This course covers the evolution of leadership theories over time. Participants will leave this course confident and prepared for their future in leadership with NMCC.
9c0f22de-bbf8-47c2-9857-60fd81c29eab.name: NMCC: Business Leadership Essentials

issuer.summary: issued by University of New Mexico - Anderson School of Management Executive & Professional Education

entity.name: University of New Mexico - Anderson School of Management Executive & Professional Education

badge_template_activities.title: Learners become more self-aware of their personal characteristics as a leader, learn how to build trust by living with integrity, clarify their purpose as a leader, engage in continual learning, understand how to regulate emotions, communicate effectively, successfully lead a team, work interdependently, act ethically, exert a positive influence over those they lead, and become more culturally aware in business.

0d412b0c-73a7-44e8-983f-ce9f3d9c58e4.description: This custom program provides management leadership development training to Nusenda managers.The instruction includes effective tools that can be applied immediately and maintained throughout the participants’ professional career. Exercises and role-playing activities ensure participants stay engaged and find opportunities to immediately apply the tools being learned, while aligning the employees’ personal values to those of the organization.
0d412b0c-73a7-44e8-983f-ce9f3d9c58e4.name: Nusenda Credit Union Management Leadership Series 2022

issuer.summary: issued by University of New Mexico - Anderson School of Management Executive & Professional Education

entity.name: University of New Mexico - Anderson School of Management Executive & Professional Education

badge_template_activities.title: This program includes 16 hours of live training broken up into four sessions. Session topics include: Effective Communication, Managing & Resolving Conflict, Leadership & Time Management, Working In Teams.

2bcde825-2436-4e18-9ae2-c147ddf7d427.description: The badge recipient has successfully completed a 3-credit course through the UNM Anderson Facilitated Internship Program. Facilitated Internships are supervised, structured learning experiences in a professional setting that allow students to gain valuable work experience. The internship offers qualified students a unique integration of the academic program, practical application, and skill development in a “real world” employment opportunity, focused on their major and/or field of study.
2bcde825-2436-4e18-9ae2-c147ddf7d427.name: UNM Anderson Facilitated Intern

issuer.summary: issued by University of New Mexico - Anderson School of Management Executive & Professional Education

entity.name: University of New Mexico - Anderson School of Management Executive & Professional Education

badge_template_activities.title: Earner has successfully earned 3-credits through the UNM Anderson Internship Program by completing a minimum of 160 hours in an approved facilitated internship position. Completed a facilitated internship with a host organization under designated internship supervisor, received verification of completion and success from the site supervisor.
